title: Right Side Investigation
description: Use RIGHT JOIN to find all job positions, including those without assigned citizens.
story: The HR department has job openings that might not have employees yet. Use RIGHT JOIN to see all positions from the jobs table, even if no citizen is assigned.
hint: RIGHT JOIN keeps all records from the RIGHT table (jobs), even when there's no match in the LEFT table (citizens). It's the opposite of LEFT JOIN.
tableSetup: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS jobs CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS citizens CASCADE;
CREATE TABLE citizens (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), age INT, district VARCHAR(50));
CREATE TABLE jobs (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, citizen_id INT, position VARCHAR(100), salary INT, department VARCHAR(50));
INSERT INTO citizens (name, age, district) VALUES ('Alice Johnson', 28, 'Downtown'), ('Bob Smith', 35, 'Uptown');
